content.question: In an experiment, an object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> slides along a horizontal surface where friction between the object and the surface is negligible. The object has an initial speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and then collides with a spring of spring constant <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi></math>, and the object compresses the spring a total distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> from the equilibrium length of the spring before coming to rest. Students observing the experiment expected the object to compress the spring a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from equilibrium, where <math alttext="D is greater than x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>D</mi><mo>></mo><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>. Assuming the students’ expectation is correct, which of the following expressions could show the change in the mechanical energy of the object – spring system during the experiment?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta E equals, one half k x squared, plus one half m v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta E equals, one half k x squared, minus one half m v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta E equals one half k, open parenthesis, D minus x, close parenthesis, squared, plus one half m v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta E equals one half k, open parenthesis, D minus x, close parenthesis, squared, minus one half m v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>D</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>
